results.title: Former Pentagon Leaders Warn of a Dangerous Era
results.abstract: The challenge to the 2020 election result has helped create “an extremely adverse environment,” former defense secretaries and generals said in an open letter.

media.caption: In summer 2020, General Mark A. Milley, right, was summoned by President Donald J. Trump for a walk across a park where protesters had just been tear-gassed so Mr. Trump could do a photo op holding a Bible.

results.title: Official Obama Portraits Are Finally Unveiled at the White House
results.abstract: In a break with tradition, there was no ceremony while former President Donald J. Trump held office. President Biden unveiled the Obama portraits: his by Robert McCurdy, hers by Sharon Sprung.

results.title: A ‘Period Dignity Officer’ Seemed Like a Good Idea. Until a Man Was Named.
results.abstract: The job in the Scottish region of Tayside was eliminated after a groundswell of anger that a man would be overseeing, or ‘mansplaining,’ menstruation policy.

media.caption: The Scottish Parliament. Scotland was the first country to adopt a law requiring universal free access to period products.

results.title: Anne Garrels, Fearless NPR Correspondent, Dies at 71

results.title: The Mars Volta Returns With a Swerve: Its Own Version of Pop
results.abstract: After taking a decade between studio releases, Cedric Bixler-Zavala and Omar Rodríguez-López eased their sonic experimentation to the sidelines for an album that still bristles.

media.caption: Cedric Bixler-Zavala and Omar Rodríguez-López of the Mars Volta. The band known for its cryptic, lengthy songs is approaching something closer to pop on a self-titled album, its first studio release since 2012.
